Executive Summary
During my internship at PwC in the Forensic Services department, I had the
opportunity to engage deeply with various projects that enhanced my understanding of
forensic investigations, fraud risk management, and compliance practices. I participated in
significant projects, including PEP, CCN, and MAIS, where I applied market research
methodologies and analytical skills to support our team’s objectives. My role involved
gathering and analyzing data while ensuring adherence to strict confidentiality protocols, a
crucial aspect of PwC's operational ethos. Throughout my internship, I learned the importance
of meticulous documentation and the need for clarity in communication. The diverse team
environment allowed me to collaborate with professionals across various levels, including
project leaders and experienced consultants, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing. The
feedback from my supervisors highlighted my contributions to market research and client
engagement, with a particular emphasis on my success in achieving 51% accurate pricing and
35% semi-priced evaluations in the PEP project. Moreover, PwC's commitment to professional
development was evident through special training sessions that enhanced my technical skills,
particularly in Excel. Under the guidance of Mr. Kayar, I developed my capabilities in data
analysis, which proved invaluable for reporting and presenting findings to clients. My
exposure to the forensic services field has equipped me with essential skills in analytical
thinking and problem-solving, allowing me to approach complex situations with a structured
mindset. I also gained insights into the importance of maintaining confidentiality and ethical
standards in all aspects of forensic work. Also PwC helped me to draw my future path in
consulting sector and gained me the vision to importance of these services and how firms look
consultants to run their companies. And undertood the structure of the company which is
very different from other companies with running every deparmtent like different companies
with the leading of the leaders which they called “partner”. In summary, my internship at
PwC was an enriching experience that solidified my interest in pursuing a career in forensic
services. The practical experience, coupled with the guidance from seasoned professionals,
has provided me with a solid foundation for my future endeavors in the field.

1. Company and Sector
a. Overview of the Company and Sector

The consulting services industry in Türkiye has experienced significant growth over
the past decade, driven by the country's dynamic economy and the increasing demand for
specialized business expertise. As Turkish companies face challenges related to globalization,
digital transformation, regulatory compliance, and sustainability, consulting firms have
become essential partners in navigating these complexities. The industry offers a wide range
of services, including management consulting, financial advisory, IT solutions, and human
resources consulting. International firms called The Big Four ,like PwC, Deloitte, and EY, as
well as local firms, are actively involved, supporting businesses across sectors such as
manufacturing, finance, and energy. Turkey's strategic location also makes it a hub for
regional consulting operations, catering to markets in Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.
PwC, one of the world’s leading professional services networks, continues to solidify its
position as a global leader in auditing, consulting, and advisory services. With a presence
in over 157 countries, PwC serves businesses, governments, and institutions of various
sizes, delivering specialized services across industries. In 2022, PwC achieved a global
revenue of $50.3 billion, a testament to its growing influence and client trust. (PwC, 2022)
PwC’s history dates back to 1849 when Samuel Lowell Price began his professional practice
in London. Over the years, through mergers and strategic expansions,
PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) was officially formed in 1998 from a merger between Price
Waterhouse and Coopers & Lybrand. Today, PwC operates under the guiding principle of
helping organizations build trust in society and solve important problems. (PwC, n.d.)
With over 327,000 employees globally, PwC's expertise spans across Assurance, Advisory,
and Tax services. The company is renowned for its comprehensive services in risk
management, regulatory compliance, digital transformation, and financial advisory. PwC
works across numerous sectors including healthcare, energy, financial services,
manufacturing, and technology, positioning itself as a critical partner for businesses
navigating complex global markets.
PwC’s consulting branch provides strategic insights into areas such as business
transformation, cybersecurity, data analytics, and environmental, social, and governance
(ESG) initiatives. Their consulting workforce comprises multidisciplinary teams that leverage

b. Organization of the Company
Table 1: Organization chart of PwC Independent Auditing and Certified Public Accounting
Inc.
PwC has been carrying on its services with under 3 different companies. These are
PwC Independent Audit, PwC Consulting and PwC Tax Services. And under these companies
there are different department which are related to company activities. Which are to Audit
and assurance, Digital, Deals, Strategy and Consulting, Forensic Services, Financial Reporting
and Accounting Services, Risk Assurance Services and Tax.
Audit and assurance: This department is responsible for providing independent auditing and
assurance services to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and compliance of financial
statements. It helps businesses meet regulatory requirements and gain investor confidence.
Services include financial statement audits, regulatory compliance reviews, and internal
control assessments.
Digital: PwC's Digital department focuses on helping companies transform their business
models through technology-driven innovation. This includes services like digital strategy
development, cloud adoption, data analytics, artificial intelligence (AI) implementation, and
digital transformation programs. The goal is to enhance business agility, improve customer
experiences, and drive operational efficiency.
Deals: The Deals department offers advisory services for mergers and acquisitions (M&A),
divestitures, restructuring, and corporate finance. PwC Deals experts guide clients through
the transaction process, from strategy development and due diligence to post-merger
integration. They help clients maximize value and navigate complex financial, legal, and
regulatory landscapes during deals.
Strategy and Consulting: This department provides strategic advisory services, assisting
companies with business planning, market entry strategies, performance improvement, and
operational efficiency. PwC consultants help businesses align their strategies with market
trends, optimize their operations, and implement long-term growth plans to remain
competitive in a rapidly changing environment.

Forensic Services: Forensic Services is focused on investigating financial irregularities, fraud
detection, and dispute resolution. This department helps clients respond to allegations of
misconduct, regulatory breaches, or financial crime by providing in-depth investigations,
forensic accounting, litigation support, and fraud risk assessments.

Financial Reporting and Accounting Services: This department offers support in managing
complex financial reporting requirements. It helps businesses comply with evolving financial
regulations, improve the quality of their financial reports, and address accounting challenges
such as revenue recognition, lease accounting, and financial instruments.

Risk Assurance Services and Tax: The Risk Assurance department assists clients in
identifying, managing, and mitigating risks related to their business operations. This includes
areas like internal audit, enterprise risk management, cybersecurity, and regulatory
compliance. The team ensures that businesses can operate confidently in a risk-controlled
environment while maintaining regulatory and operational standards. PwC’s Tax department
provides comprehensive tax advisory and compliance services. This includes corporate tax,
international tax structuring, transfer pricing, VAT and indirect taxes, and tax compliance
management. The team helps businesses navigate complex tax laws, optimize their tax
positions, and ensure compliance with local and international regulations.

c. Production/Service System
Table 2: Organizational structure of service systems of PwC Independent Auditing and
Certified Public Accounting Inc.
At PwC, the service delivery process follows a structured approach like an assembly line,
ensuring that every client need is handled with precision and expertise. When a client
request is received, PwC first categorizes it under the appropriate service lines, such as Audit
and Assurance, Tax, or Consulting. The Client Engagement Team begins by defining the
scope of the project and setting clear timelines, like delivery planning in a production
process. Once the scope is set, the Planning & Management team steps in to assess resource
needs and assign the right specialists from departments like Financial Reporting, Deals, or
Risk Assurance. During the project, continuous quality control is ensured through the Risk &
Quality team, which monitors compliance and service accuracy.
After the project is delivered, PwC’s Internal Audit and Risk Management teams perform
final checks to ensure that all processes meet internal standards and regulatory compliance.
For international clients, the Tax and Regulatory Compliance teams ensure that any cross-
border regulations are adhered to before the project is completed. Once the deliverables
are approved and meet the necessary requirements, they are submitted to the client. The
8

project is only considered complete after the client’s final feedback, and any post-delivery
requirements, such as adjustments or further consulting, are addressed promptly.

d. Professional and Ethical Responsibilities of Engineers
At PwC, a team of skilled engineers and consultants plays a pivotal role in upholding the
firm’s commitment to professional and ethical responsibilities. The engineers at PwC are
dedicated to fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the
organization. Their primary objective is to enhance internal processes and deliver high-
quality services that meet client expectations while adhering to regulatory standards.
Engineers are trained to identify and address any unethical practices or inhumane working
conditions, ensuring that all projects align with the firm’s ethical guidelines. They maintain a
keen sense of integrity in their professional interactions, prioritizing honesty and objectivity
in all communications with clients and colleagues.
Confidentiality is paramount; engineers are expected to protect sensitive information and
refrain from disclosing proprietary knowledge to unauthorized parties. They must provide
transparent feedback regarding project developments, whether positive or negative, to
ensure effective decision-making. Additionally, PwC engineers are committed to
sustainability and environmental stewardship, actively seeking ways to minimize the
ecological impact of their operations. They are also encouraged to mentor junior engineers,
fostering a collaborative environment that promotes knowledge sharing and professional
growth. By embodying these ethical principles, PwC engineers contribute to a positive
workplace culture and reinforce the firm’s reputation as a trusted advisor in the consulting
industry.

2. Summer Practice Description
During my internship period, I had the opportunity to meet a lot of people. I attended
many briefings and participated in projects. I took a role in Forensic Services under
consulting services as forensic data analyst intern.
They serve companies to find and analyze if any corruption in the company or suspicious
about financial issues. Forensic Services give three main services which are Fraud Risk
Management & Investigations, Ethics & Compliance and Crisis Management & Forensic
Intelligence.
There were many employees in the office which are experienced in different bachelors
from engineering to business management from the top universities of Türkiye and the
world. So, I had the opportunity to gain a lot of experience such as better understanding of
human relations, observing the projects of engineers, participating in company projects and
relations, learning about investigations applied to company employees that served. I mostly
worked with Mr. Erdem, who is the manager newly participated to team from KPMG, and
Miss. Priyeva, who is the Senior Associate.
Since the first day of the internship, I attended the Market Research for the very known
bevarege company in Türkiye. The purpose of the research is to confirm that company had
paid exorbitant prices to products they supplied from a supplier. My superiors were very
satisfied with the job I have done because they were not able to find every purchase order
given from the client, but I have shown success with %51 accurate pricing and %35 semi
pricing. Every day at the end of the day, I prepared a progress report with the data that Miss.
Priyeva gave. In the report, it is written that the names of the purchase orders, the total
amount of order, the details about orders, the price taken by the client and the price I found
from different suppliers across Türkiye. With these data, I prepared an excel that includes
everything and will help the client to compare prices.
The responsible/managers and the partner of Forensic, examined the sheet I have made at
the end of the project and stated the importance of duty I have done to closing the project.
Mr. Erdem mostly gave me duties with business development of forensic technologies which
is supplying to clients and evaluated me the systems we are developing. We were
developing a database which is supplying the client’s corporate intelligence. My primary
responsibilities included assisting in data collection and analysis for forensic investigations,
reviewing financial documents, and preparing detailed reports to support our findings. I
collaborated closely with my team to identify potential discrepancies and assess the
integrity of the financial data we analyzed. Additionally, I participated in meetings with
clients to discuss our progress and present our preliminary findings.
My superiors provided positive feedback on my ability to quickly adapt to the challenging
environment and my keen eye for detail. They noted my effective communication skills and
ability to work collaboratively within a team setting, which contributed significantly to our
project's success. Overall, my experience in the Forensic Services department has not only
enhanced my technical skills but also deepened my understanding of the complexities
involved in forensic investigations.
 Activity Analysis
My internship at PwC in the Forensic Services department provided me with
invaluable experience and insights into the world of forensic consulting. During my
internship, I had the opportunity to work on several significant projects, including the PEP,
CCN, and MAIS. I cannot provide company names due to confidentiality. This report aims to
detail my activities, learning experiences, and contributions during my time at PwC, as well
11

Business Development Contributions
As part of my responsibilities, I also focused on business development initiatives related to
the three services:
Evaluating the Robot: I played a role in evaluating the automated tools used in the
Corporate Intelligence Service. My findings and feedback helped the team refine the
functionality of these tools, ensuring they met client needs effectively, contributing to a
increase in operational efficiency.
Webpage Design: I assisted in designing a user-friendly webpage for the services offered by
the department. The newly designed webpage increased user engagement.
Data Analysis and RStudio
In my role, I contributed to data analysis efforts by creating Excel sheets that streamlined
processes for my supervisor, Mr. Erdem. I performed data clarification and sorting to
identify potentially suspicious patterns. This not only improved the efficiency of our
investigations but also enhanced my analytical skills.
Excel Tools: I developed 5 key Excel tools that automated the data sorting process, reducing
the time required for analysis by approximately 30%.
I also introduced my supervisor to RStudio, a programming environment for statistical
computing and graphics. After demonstrating its capabilities, I assisted him in utilizing
RStudio for data analysis, which significantly simplified our workflow and enabled us to
analyze larger datasets more effectively.
RStudio Implementation: We used RStudio to analyze a dataset of 3000+ entries, resulting in
clearer insights into potential fraud patterns.
The experiences I gained during my internship at PwC which is one of the biggest consulting
firms in the world were invaluable. Some of the key lessons learned include:
14

Importance of Clarity and Tidiness: I recognized the need for clear and organized
documentation. Projects can be handed over to different team members, making it essential
to maintain a tidy workflow to ensure continuity and efficiency.
Understanding Fraud Risks: I gained a deeper understanding of the several types of fraud
and the importance of initiative-taking risk management strategies. Learning how to identify
red flags and vulnerabilities in business operations was particularly enlightening.
Data Analysis Skills: My involvement in data analytics strengthened my analytical skills and
provided me with practical experience in preparing and visualizing data for fraud detection.
Confidentiality: My superiors emphasized the significance of confidentiality in forensic
services. Understanding how to manage sensitive information responsibly has prepared me
for future roles in the field.
Collaborative Teamwork: Collaborating with various sub-teams taught me the value of
collaboration and leveraging diverse expertise to achieve project goals.
Application of Ethical Principles: I learned the ethical standards that govern the forensic
consulting industry. Adhering to these principles is crucial for maintaining client trust and
ensuring the integrity of our work.
My supervisors provided constructive feedback on my performance throughout the
internship. They commended my ability to adapt quickly to new tasks and my initiative-
taking approach to problem-solving. My supervisors highlighted my strong analytical skills
and diligence, particularly in data analysis and reporting tasks. They mentioned that my non-
corporate habits will be especially useful in my future work life and will make me different
from my colleagues. It came from my habits to not following rules. They appreciated my
contributions to the team especially for the partipation of PEP market research and
acknowledged my willingness to learn and take on challenges.
In summary, my internship at PwC in the Forensic Services department was a transformative
experience that equipped me with practical skills and knowledge applicable to the field of
forensic consulting. I am grateful for the opportunity to work on diverse projects, engage in
market research, and contribute to service development initiatives. The guidance and
support from my supervisors have been instrumental in my growth, and I am eager to apply
what I have learned in my future career endeavors. The lessons learned about
professionalism, ethics, and collaboration will undoubtedly influence my approach to work
in the consulting industry moving forward.
15

3. Conclusions
My internship at PwC has been an invaluable period of growth and learning. I gained
experience within the Forensic Services department, collaborating with a diverse group of
professionals, from seasoned consultants to project managers. This exposure allowed me to
understand various perspectives and approaches in the field of forensic consulting,
significantly enriching my professional development.
Participating in projects like PEP, CCN, and MAIS provided me with direct experience in
market research and data analytics, enhancing my analytical skills and reinforcing the
importance of thoroughness in documentation and client communication. I learned the
nuances of confidentiality and ethical responsibilities, which are paramount in forensic
services.
Working with advanced tools and systems, such as RStudio and PwC’s proprietary
technologies, I developed technical competencies that will serve me well in my future
career. Additionally, I had the opportunity to observe the intricate processes involved in
fraud risk management, gaining insights into how teams collaborate to identify and mitigate
risks effectively.
This internship has clarified my career aspirations and underscored the importance of
continuous improvement and lifelong learning in the professional world. I now realize the
value of being initiative-taking and diligent in my endeavors, motivating me to enhance my
academic performance and prepare thoroughly for my future career. I am grateful for the
mentorship and support I received from my colleagues and supervisors, which have
equipped me with the skills and confidence to navigate my professional journey ahead.

a. Impact
PwC plays a pivotal role in the consulting landscape, particularly within the forensic
services sector, significantly influencing economic, global, environmental, and social
dimensions. The firm operates on a global scale, providing a wide range of services that
cater to diverse industries and clients. PwC's commitment to ambitious standards and
ethical practices not only enhances its reputation but also bolsters confidence in the
consulting industry. The economic impact of PwC is substantial, with the firm contributing to
the growth and stability of the financial sector. By helping clients navigate complex
regulatory environments and mitigate risks, PwC fosters a healthier business ecosystem. The
firm's involvement in high-stakes investigations and compliance assessments aids in
maintaining market integrity, which supports investor confidence and economic resilience.
On a global level, PwC operates in numerous countries, enabling the exchange of knowledge
and best practices across borders. The firm collaborates with various organizations,
including multinational corporations and government agencies, to drive positive change and
foster sustainable practices. Through its forensic services, PwC helps organizations identify
and address issues related to fraud, corruption, and ethical misconduct, which not only
safeguards their interests but also promotes a culture of accountability within the business
community. Socially, PwC is dedicated to corporate social responsibility initiatives,
emphasizing the importance of ethical behavior and community engagement. The firm
encourages its employees to participate in volunteer activities and support local
communities, thereby contributing to societal well-being. This commitment to social impact
aligns with PwC's core values and strengthens its relationships with stakeholders.In terms of
16

environmental impact, PwC recognizes the significance of sustainability and has
implemented measures to reduce its carbon footprint. By promoting green practices and
responsible resource management within its operations, PwC demonstrates leadership in
environmental stewardship. The firm actively engages with clients to help them develop
sustainable business strategies, thereby contributing to a more sustainable future.
In summary, PwC's multifaceted impact extends beyond its immediate business operations.
The firm serves as a catalyst for positive change, driving economic growth, promoting ethical
practices, enhancing social responsibility, and advocating for environmental sustainability.
Through its forensic services and broader consulting efforts, PwC continues to shape a
better business landscape for clients and society alike.

b. Team Work
During my internship at PwC, I was fortunate to experience a collaborative work
environment that emphasized the importance of teamwork across various projects.
Throughout my time, I had the privilege of collaborating with experienced professionals,
each bringing unique expertise and perspectives to the table. One of my primary
collaborators was Ms. Priyeva, a senior consultant in the forensic services department. Her
extensive background in forensic analysis and investigative procedures was invaluable to my
learning experience. She generously shared her insights on effective communication and
problem-solving strategies, guiding me in navigating complex project requirements.
Together, we participated in project meetings where we discussed findings and strategies
for enhancing our investigative approaches. I also worked closely with Mr. Erdem, a data
analyst who specializes in data visualization. His proficiency with analytical tools and
techniques significantly enriched my understanding of data interpretation. We collaborated
on a project aimed at identifying anomalies in financial records, where Mr. Erdem’s
analytical skills complemented my market research efforts. His mentorship was crucial in
helping me grasp the intricacies of data analysis and reporting. Additionally, I had the
opportunity to engage with Mr. Yilmaz, the partner overseeing several key initiatives. His
leadership style fostered an inclusive environment, encouraging team members to
contribute their ideas freely. During team brainstorming sessions, I learned the importance
of diverse viewpoints in problem-solving. Mr. Yilmaz emphasized that each team member’s
input was vital, which motivated me to share my perspectives confidently. My collaboration
with Ms. Bulut, who works in compliance, was particularly enlightening. We worked on the
Corporate Intelligence service, where her expertise in regulatory frameworks and
compliance issues was instrumental. Together, we conducted extensive research to gather
relevant information for our clients, ensuring that our recommendations were both
actionable and aligned with legal standards. Collaborating with various teams, I participated
in the PEP and MAIS projects, where I observed firsthand the dynamics of cross-functional
collaboration. Each team brought together professionals from different disciplines, allowing
us to tackle complex challenges comprehensively. The constructive collaboration created by
our diverse skill sets fostered an innovative atmosphere, enabling us to generate creative
solutions and deliver high-quality results. The experience of collaborating with colleagues
from diverse backgrounds and expertise not only enhanced my understanding of forensic
services but also provided me with valuable insights into the consulting industry. I found it
immensely rewarding to contribute to a team environment where knowledge sharing, and
mutual support were prioritized. The opportunity to collaborate with such talented
individuals has motivated me to further develop my teamwork skills, which I recognize as
essential for success in my future career.

c. Self-directed Learning
Throughout my internship at PwC, I embraced self-directed learning as a key component
of my professional development. Recognizing the importance of continuous improvement in
a challenging environment, I sought opportunities to enhance my skills and knowledge
independently. One of the most significant areas I focused on was Excel proficiency. With
the guidance of Mr. Kayar, I was able to delve deeper into advanced Excel functionalities,
learning essential techniques such as pivot tables, advanced formulas, and data visualization
methods. And learned excel web format which has different futures but also helps to use
sharing excel sheet. This not only improved my efficiency in handling data but also equipped
me with the necessary tools to contribute effectively to various projects. I also had to chance
to experience the theoretical RStudio that I learnt to practical. And with the most exciting
thing I had to chance to experience the “ChatPwC” which is a product of OpenAI like
ChatGPT, but it is all designed for PwC with a collaboration it offers more confidentiality,
more authentic information powered by PwC database. Additionally, PwC provided a range
of specialized training sessions aimed at fostering professional growth. These trainings
covered critical aspects of forensic services, including ethical standards, compliance
protocols, and advanced analytical methods. Participating in these sessions allowed me to
deepen my understanding of the industry and stay updated with the latest practices. The
combination of formal training and self-directed study significantly enriched my internship
experience, empowering me to take on new challenges with confidence and competence.
Through this initiative-taking approach to learning, I developed a more comprehensive skill
set that not only benefited my contributions during the internship but also laid a solid
foundation for my future career in forensic services.
